pyforecho.api.client module¶

class pyforecho.api.client.Client(requests_class, logger)¶

Bases: object

create(phone, group_key, name, internal_id=None, location=None, login_code=None, lat=None, lon=None, labels=[])¶

Add a client to the contact list

Params:

phone (str) - A phone number in the ISO format group_key (str) - The key for the contact group to create the client in. For a client already in another contact group, they’ll be moved to this group. For existing client (found via lookup), this is the attribute ‘group_key’. For non-existing clients, it seems that you’d need to look at the network request made when you open the contact group on the EchoMobile dashboard. name (str) - The client’s name

Optional:

internal_id (int) - For existing clients, this is the field ‘eid’ location (str) login_code (str) lat (str) lon (str) labels (str list)

get_all(since, group_name, fields=[], page=1)¶

Return a list of all clients in a contact group

Params:

since (int) - Return the contacts synced into this group, since this Unix timestamp group_name - The name of the contact group as on the EchoMobile dashboard (This is not the group key)

Optional:

fields (str list) page (int) - For pagination purposes. The first page is 1, and results are paginated at 1000 items

Returns

resp_ (ls) - List of clients in that group

lookup(phone, fields=None)¶

Search for a client using a phone number (in ISO format)

Params:

phone (str) - A phone number in the ISO format fields (str list) - List of field names to return

Returns

resp_ (dict) - Dict with client attrs
